intro: Terminalia hadleyana subsp. carpentariae, commonly known as the Carpentaria terminalia, is a small to medium-sized tree native to northern Australia. It belongs to the family Combretaceae and is characterized by its smooth, greyish bark and elliptical leaves that are usually arranged alternately along the stems. The plant produces small, clustered white flowers followed by edible, fleshy berries that are a food source for local wildlife. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in coastal and riverine habitats.
